summary: This document is a sealed grand jury subpoena and non-disclosure order issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to Facebook, Inc. It commands Facebook to produce all records associated with Ghislaine Maxwell's accounts and prohibits Facebook from notifying her or any third party about the subpoena for 365 days, citing risks to the investigation.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.context: Issued the grand jury subpoena to Facebook, Inc. as the United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York.

persons.name: Sarah Netburn
persons.context: Signed the 2705(b) non-disclosure order, sealing the subpoena and application, determining that notification could jeopardize the investigation.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subpoena specifically requests all Facebook records for any accounts registered to or associated with her name, phone numbers, and email addresses.

connections.description: Berman, as U.S. Attorney, is leading the grand jury investigation for which Maxwell is the target of the subpoena for her Facebook records.

events.title: Issuance of Sealed Subpoena to Facebook
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office issued a sealed grand jury subpoena to Facebook, Inc. for all records related to Ghislaine Maxwell's accounts, accompanied by a non-disclosure order.

events.title: Subpoena Return Date
events.description: The date by which Facebook was commanded to produce the requested records to the FBI, unless they complied earlier by sending them to a specified Special Agent.

locations: Silvio J. Mollo Building (One Saint Andrew's Plaza), New York, New York 10007
United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, Room 220, New York, New York
Facebook, Inc., 1601 Willow Road, Menlo Park, California 94025
Federal Bureau of Investigation, 26 Federal Plaza, VCAC/Human Trafficking, New York, NY 10278
keyFacts: The U.S. government was actively investigating Ghislaine Maxwell in November 2019, seeking a wide array of her personal data from Facebook under grand jury authority.
The investigation was cited as involving suspected violations of federal laws including 18 U.S.C. §§ 1591 (sex trafficking), 371 (conspiracy), and 2423 (transportation for illegal sexual activity).
A judge sealed the subpoena and issued a 365-day non-disclosure order to prevent Maxwell from learning about it, citing risks of flight, evidence destruction, and witness intimidation.
The requested records were extensive, covering subscriber info, session/IP logs, payment methods, correspondence, and investigative files related to Maxwell's accounts.
